definition: prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]

sentences.english: Note the Arabic lettering on her MP sleeve insignia.
sentences.chinese: 请注意阿拉伯文刻字她手机套徽章。

sentences.english: Arabic is written in the opposite direction to English, that is, from right to left.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯文的书写方向与英文相反，即从右到左。

sentences.english: Hebrew and Arabic provide examples of languages that naturally flow from right-to-left.
sentences.chinese: 希伯来文和阿拉伯文提供了由右至左书写的语言范例。

sentences.english: We have made it a Qur'an in Arabic, that ye may be able to understand (and learn wisdom).
sentences.chinese: 我确已以此为阿拉伯文的《古兰经》，以便你们了解。

sentences.english: Some of the supported languages are Chinese, Arabic, German, and French.
sentences.chinese: 某些支持语言是中文，阿拉伯文，德文或者法文。

definition: Syriac language (from c. 2nd century BC)/the Syriac script
Chinese written language/Chinese literature esp. as taught abroad
Pali, language of Theravad Pali canon
